content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Hello Max, it's a pleasure to meet you. I'm sure you'll find this apartment to be a great investment. So, let's discuss the price. How much are you willing to pay per month?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I'm a student, and I'm looking for a place that's smartly priced, dependable, and won't trick me with hidden costs. I want to be fair and stick to the terms we agree on. I'm also keen to maintain a good relationship with my landlord. Now, regarding the price, I'm looking for the best deal possible. How low can we go for this 50 square meter apartment in the city center?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, I understand your concerns. As a landlord, I value honesty and transparency. I want to ensure that you have a comfortable living space without any surprises. Let's negotiate a price that is fair for both parties. How much would you consider paying per month?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I appreciate your approach. As a student, I'm on a budget, so I'm looking for a price that reflects the value of the apartment while also being mindful of my financial situation. I'm willing to pay a fair price for a place that's new, unfurnished, and centrally located. How can we work out a number that is agreeable to both of us?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, I'm here to listen to your offer. Please tell me what you believe is a fair price for this apartment, and we can work from there.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I'm looking to pay a monthly rent that's in line with similar apartments in the area. I'm not interested in overpaying, but I also understand the value of a good location and a new building. How about we start at €750 per month? I think that's a reasonable offer considering the size and condition of the apartment. What do you think?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, your offer of €750 per month is quite low for an apartment of this quality in the city center. However, I'm willing to negotiate. How about we meet in the middle? €900 per month would be a fair compromise, in my opinion. What do you say?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, €900 per month is a significant amount for a student like me. While I appreciate the quality of the apartment, I must remain within my budget. I'm willing to go up to €800 per month, which I believe is a fair reflection of the apartment's value and my financial situation. Would you be willing to accept this offer?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, I understand your budget constraints as a student. However, €800 per month is still below the market value for this apartment. I'm willing to be flexible, but I must also consider the investment I've made in this property. How about this: if you can pay €850 per month, we have a deal. That's my final offer. What do you say?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, €850 per month is more acceptable, but it's still quite a stretch for me as a student. I'm looking for a price that reflects the fact that the apartment is unfurnished and that I'm willing to enter into a long-term lease. How about we agree on €825 per month, and in exchange, I commit to a two-year lease? This would provide you with some stability and help me manage my monthly expenses. Would you consider this offer?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, your offer of €825 per month with a two-year lease is an interesting proposition. I'm willing to accept this deal if you agree to one additional condition. If you decide to break the lease prematurely, you will be responsible for the remaining rent payments for the duration of the lease term. This is to protect my investment in the event that you choose to move out before the lease expires. Do we have a deal at €825 per month with a two-year lease and this additional clause?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
